data.title: Atlassian Q4 2025 Earnings Call Aug 07, 2025
data.overview: Atlassian closed FY'25 with $5.2 billion in revenue and $1.4 billion in free cash flow, highlighting strong enterprise execution—a record number of deals >$1 million in ACV (up >2x YoY) and cloud net revenue retention of 120%—while product momentum was broad-based with Jira, Confluence, Jira Service Management and Loom growing in line with or faster than the company. AI adoption accelerated (2.3 million AI users, up 50% QoQ; token usage up 5x QoQ) and Atlassian reported early Teamwork Collection (Team '25) traction exceeding expectations; management emphasized AI, enterprise expansion and the Atlassian system of work as the three strategic transformations, and announced a Google Cloud partnership to advance multi-cloud AI infrastructure. Leadership noted continued focus on cloud migrations and enterprise go-to-market as growth levers, and disclosed an executive transition with Anu departing as President at year end.
